intro: Hemsleya macrosperma var. macrosperma, commonly known as the giant hemslay, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that feature vibrant purple to red flowers, which bloom in terminal clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments in its natural habitat.
